TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

Articles.Content: Is there any way to bookmark or save specific posts?  i.e. a "Save for Later" button so I can come back to a post when after I get home from browsing KSP at work (tsk tsk)?  I know that using 'Like' will save them to my activity feed, but that's tedious to browse through and browsing through something I liked in a specific thread (i.e. What Did You Do IN KSP Today? for somethign I want to try) is also quite a daunting task.

Just to add on to Frybert's excellent explanation:

- There's nothing whatsoever negative about reporting per se.  "Report" does not mean "accuse".  It simply means "get the mods' attention for something."  It can (and often is) used to report inappropriate content, but it doesn't have to be.  For example, you can report your *<u>own</u>* post, if you need help with something you can't do yourself (e.g. "I accidentally posted and want to delete this").
- Reports can actually help the mod staff by giving us extra pairs of eyes in the forums.  We can't be everywhere all the time.
- Reporting inappropriate posts can be especially useful because there are some types of posts that can kick off firestorms, and it's a *<u>lot</u>* better for everyone concerned (moderators and forumgoers alike) if those can be spotted quickly and nipped in the bud before they spiral out of control.
- Another example: if you report a post for being in the wrong subforum... you're not just helping your fellow forumgoers (by reducing noise in the "wrong" forum), but *<u>you're actually helping the person you're reporting</u>* because now their thread will live in a better home where it's likely to get more of the right sort of attention.

So you're doing everyone a favor by making an appropriate report.
